instructions: Go to Settings > General > Accessibility > Display Accommodations. Adjust any of the following controls: Auto-Brightness: iPhone automatically adjusts the screen brightness for current light conditions using the built-in ambient light sensor. Invert Colors: Choose Smart Invert or Classic Invert. Or use accessibility shortcuts . Smart Invert Colors reverses the colors of the display, except for images, media, and some apps that use dark color styles. Color Filters: Then turn on Color Filters or use accessibility shortcuts . Tap a filter to apply it. To adjust the intensity or hue, drag the sliders. Reduce White Point: This setting reduces the intensity of bright colors.

Go to Settings > General > Accessibility. Adjust any of the following controls: Larger Text: Turn on Larger Accessibility Sizes, then adjust the text size using the Font Size slider. iPhone adjusts to your preferred text size in apps that support Dynamic Type, such as Settings, Calendar, Contacts, Mail, Messages, and Notes. Bold Text: This setting requires restarting your iPhone. Button Shapes: This setting underlines text you can tap. On/Off Labels: This setting indicates switches turned on with 1 and switches turned off with 0 .

Go to Settings > General > Accessibility > Reduce Motion, then turn on Reduce Motion. To prevent iPhone from automatically playing bubble and full-screen effects in Messages, turn off Auto-Play Message Effects. To manually play effects in Messages, tap Replay below the message bubble.
In the Sound browser, tap Live Loops. In the Template browser, swipe left or right to view additional templates. Tap a template.
In the Live Loops grid, tap the Browser button Browser button . In the Template browser, tap a different template.

Open the official Instagram app on your iOS or Android device. From your Instagram profile, tap the hamburger menu in the top-right corner. Tap Settings . Tap Account . Tap Switch to Creator Account . If you currently have a regular personal account on Instagram, tap Switch to Professional Account instead, then tap Creator . Tap Next . Tap the category you want your Instagram profile associated with, then tap Next . Tap the toggle switches for Display category label and Display contact info to show or hide them to other users on your Instagram profile. These Instagram profile controls can be changed at any time in the future. Tap Done . Your Creator profile Instagram account will now be live. If you ever need or want to revert your account back to a personal profile or a Business account, simply repeat these steps and choose the appropriate options in Settings > Account .
